meanings.definition: To formally declare one's abandonment or rejection of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to renounce her old habits and start fresh.
meanings.sent2: He had to renounce his claim to the throne in order to avoid a conflict.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to renounce its usual aloofness and snuggled up to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to renounce his favorite color to try a new palette.
meanings.sent5: The student had to renounce procrastination to succeed in school.

meanings.definition: To give up or refuse to follow or adhere to something.
meanings.sent1: They had to renounce their unhealthy eating habits for the sake of their health.
meanings.sent2: She had to renounce her dream of becoming a singer due to stage fright.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to renounce his usual tricks and try something new.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to renounce his fear of failure to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to renounce the comfort of home to embark on a dangerous journey.

meanings.definition: To disown or refuse to acknowledge something.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy family decided to renounce their black sheep son.
meanings.sent2: She had to renounce her former mentor after discovering his unethical practices.
meanings.sent3: The company had to renounce its faulty product to maintain its reputation.
meanings.sent4: The politician had to renounce his controversial statement to appease the public.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to renounce his outdated theory in light of new evidence.
